vmiCacheAttrs.h

00013 
00014 #ifndef VMI_CACHE_ATTRS_H
00015 #define VMI_CACHE_ATTRS_H
00016 
00017 // VMI header files
00018 #include "vmi/vmiTypes.h"
00019 
00020 
00022 // CACHE FUNCTION TYPES USED IN vmiIASAttrs STRUCTURE
00024 
00025 //
00026 // VMI cache types - only level 1 Instruction and Data caches supported
00027 //
00028 typedef enum vmiCacheTypeE {
00029     VMI_CT_I = 0,  // level 1 instruction
00030     VMI_CT_D = 1,  // level 1 data
00031     VMI_CT_LAST    // KEEP LAST - May be used for array size
00032 } vmiCacheType, *vmiCacheTypeP;
00033 
00034 //
00035 // Function to call on a Cache hit.
00036 // userData is value provided by caller when cache was enabled
00037 //
00038 #define VMI_CACHE_HIT_FN(_NAME) void _NAME( \
00039     vmiProcessorP  processor,      \
00040     Uns32          rowIndex,       \
00041     Addr           hitAddr,        \
00042     void          *userData        \
00043 )
00044 typedef VMI_CACHE_HIT_FN((*vmiCacheHitFn));
00045 
00046 //
00047 // Function to call on a cache miss
00048 // Return value will be passed as cacheContext when this entry is evicted
00049 // userData is value provided by caller when cache was enabled
00050 //
00051 #define VMI_CACHE_MISS_FN(_NAME) void *_NAME( \
00052     vmiProcessorP  processor,      \
00053     Uns32          rowIndex,       \
00054     Addr           missAddr,       \
00055     Addr           victimAddr,     \
00056     void          *cacheContext,   \
00057     void          *userData        \
00058 )
00059 typedef VMI_CACHE_MISS_FN((*vmiCacheMissFn));
00060 
00061 //
00062 // Function to call on a cache invalidate
00063 // cacheContext is return value from miss callback when victim was added
00064 // userData is value provided by caller when cache was enabled
00065 //
00066 #define VMI_CACHE_INVALIDATE_FN(_NAME) void _NAME( \
00067     vmiProcessorP  processor,      \
00068     Uns32          rowIndex,       \
00069     Addr           invalidateAddr, \
00070     Addr           victimAddr,     \
00071     void          *cacheContext,   \
00072     void          *userData        \
00073 )
00074 typedef VMI_CACHE_INVALIDATE_FN((*vmiCacheInvalidateFn));
00075 
00076 //
00077 // Called to enable/disable a cache and register/clear callbacks for cache events
00078 //
00079 // When enable is true the cache is enabled, when false it is disabled
00080 //
00081 // CB functions may be specified as NULL if no callback is required.
00082 //
00083 // Returns a unique name for the cache if successful, If the same cache
00084 // is connected to multiple processors they will each get the same name returned.
00085 // NULL if no cache with that type is available
00086 //
00087 // userData will be passed to callback functions
00088 //
00089 // To get callbacks on all cache events this must be called for every
00090 // processor connected to the cache when the cache is shared between
00091 // multiple processors (e.g. in a multi-threaded processor)
00092 //
00093 #define VMI_CACHE_REGISTER_FN(_NAME) const char * _NAME( \
00094     vmiProcessorP        processor,     \
00095     vmiCacheType         cacheType,     \
00096     Bool                 enable,        \
00097     vmiCacheHitFn        hitCB,         \
00098     vmiCacheMissFn       missCB,        \
00099     vmiCacheInvalidateFn invalidateCB,  \
00100     void                *userData       \
00101 )
00102 typedef VMI_CACHE_REGISTER_FN((*vmiCacheRegisterFn));
00103 
00104 #endif /* VMI_CACHE_ATTRS_H */
